main event: A USAF pilot reported an unusual atmospheric phenomenon resembling a red glow on the horizon south of Bermuda on January 24, 1949, during a flight, which lasted for about 1 hour and 24 minutes.
interesting points: The red glow resembled a burning ship at first, then appeared like a mushroom with a bluish-white base and red shaft lights., Witnesses described the glow as being transparent enough to see stars through it., The phenomenon significantly illuminated the water's surface and surrounding clouds., The crew was able to approach to within 100-150 feet of the mass, which was estimated to be 1-1Â½ miles wide., The lights were similar to the aurora borealis, but the observers noted they did not resemble the northern lights they had seen before.
sighted object: A red glowing mass with bluish-white shafts of light
witness description: Crew members of a B-29 bomber, which included a pilot, co-pilot, and radar operator, all with above-average intelligence and excellent character.
